abstract: Service industry employees are facing serious issue of exhaustion as restaurants, retailers and other businesses shrink time between shifts and cut staff to shave costs; many workers regularly work both late-night and early-morning shifts, leaving little time for family and sleep; pushback by labor advocates has resulted in legislative proposals in several states that would curb maximum number of work hours in a 24-hour period.
lead_paragraph: As restaurants, retailers and other businesses shrink the intervals between shifts and rely on smaller staffs to shave costs, employees are losing sleep.

headline.main: In Service Sector, No Rest for the Working
headline.print_headline: In Service Sector, No Rest for the Working
